title: Case 2
description: 68M presenting with acute unilateral vision loss OD

patientPresentation.text: A 68-year-old male presents to an emergency eye clinic with decreased unilateral vision loss from 20/50 to 20/100 OD since last visit. He had cataract surgery one month prior in this right eye. His most recent HbA1C was 5.4%. The patient's OCT is shown below.

q.title: Question 1
q.text: What abnormalities do you visualize in the patient's OCT image?

0.answerText: Loss of Foveal Contour and Epi-retinal Membrane

explanation.text:
**The abnormalities on the OCT are:** 
1) Loss of foveal contour and epi-retinal membrane
2) Well-defined intra-retinal cysts
3) Sub-retinal fluid

q.title: Question 2
q.text: What abnormalities do you visualize in the patient's OCT image?

0.answerText: Loss of Foveal Contour and Epi-retinal Membrane

explanation.text:
